website_summaries.verdict: A compact mouse that can go a good three years before you'll have to change the batteries. Some felt that the scroll bar was subpar, though.
pros: Ergonomic shape and rubber grips are comfortable to use
Comes with a Unifying receiver, an on-off switch, and a smart sleep mode
Includes two AA batteries that have a battery life of three years
cons: Mouse is on the small side
Scroll bar has generated some complaints, including that it scrolls too fast and wears out too quickly

customer_reviews.title: Deeply Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is much smaller than the website states. It measures at a length of appx 3.5" The device I was hoping to replace is pictured and is appx 4.5". As I have larger hands and fingers, I am disappointed at receiving a smaller than advertised item. The site P/N is inconsistent with actual P/N on device's bottom label. I am returning after actually only having for a half hour or so. I am deeply disappointed as I wasted time and time is money.
customer_reviews.author: JBF31643

customer_reviews.title: Lagging, Skipping, Jumping What's going on with this thing???
customer_reviews.text: Either my unit is defective, or Logitech did not make it very compatible with the new Macbook Pros. The description says it's compatible but it arrived in the mail today and I connected it and when I tell you that it was unusable due to skipping, sticking, freezing, jumping, lagging trust me. I am going to contact Logitech support to see if there are some settings that I need to change, but my current mouse (though worn down) works perfectly so it is not my computer or usb hub that's the problem. I prefer not to have to send this back so I hope Logitech tech support can get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse...but
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my previous Logitech mouse, which was about 10 years old...so I'm certainly a fan of Logitech. The problem with the 525 mouse it that many sections of it are made of shinny plastic...VERY difficult to see in the illustrations for this product on Amazon. My previous mouse had a mat finish and felt good in the hand. The shinny plastic on this mouse shows every fingerprint and smudge on top and bottom. Sometimes it sticks to your skin when your hand sweats caused by the slick surface. I'm going to try it one more day or two but will probably return it for something with a matte surface.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable for the office
customer_reviews.text: Acceptable for the office in that standard usage of this mouse would bring positive results. This mouse is not comfortable enough in the compact category as it is a little too tall for that. And, as other reviewers mentioned the mouse wheel is free flowing so the mouse is useless for gaming. I am in the market for a true compact mouse with a lower profile, so I swapped this with my office mouse, which is infinitely more effective for gaming. I wouldn't purchase this again, and I will probably buy another mouse better suited to my needs.
customer_reviews.author: AB77

customer_reviews.title: Feels Great in My Hand and Has An Expensive Look
customer_reviews.text: I use both my left and right hand when using a mouse depending on what hand is least tired, and it feels amazing on either hand. The build quality is great and its movement is that right point where it has enough friction to not slide everywhere but not enough to be hard to move. Plus moving it is more silent than other mice I've used (I don't use a mouse pad). Only problem is with the click, it's satisfying for awhile but is too noticeable in a quiet room. Wish there was a way to switch it on and off. It's great nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality mouse
customer_reviews.text: Idk if this is ideal for gaming, but I use this for work. This works fine and the battery usage life is pretty good. I haven’t changed the battery since I purchased it and it’s lasted a while. The mouse scrolls fast which some people might not like, but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I might have Is that the blister packaging forces you to cut the instructions in half to get the package open.Once I got through that trial, however.The mouse work really well. I have a repetitive stress injury in my armThat requires amounts to be positioned just soAnd support my hand just so...This mouse is very good at both.I would prefer a little bit larger chassis,But that's my personal preference, not a shortcoming of this mouse. Hooked up to myMacBook ProSuper easily in les than five seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Bluedogz

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today so don't know about battery or durability but this seems like a great, well made mouse. I like the simple, easy and functional design. Right/left clicks, scrolling wheel that is the smoothest I have EVER used and so nice to be able to page left/right just by tilting the scroll wheel rather than trying to depress a side button. Highly recommend this mouse
customer_reviews.author: Bill F

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bangs for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse for someone looking for a quick and easy to use replacement. The pairing is good and the battery is long lived. The tracking is quick and there are no issues with multiple surfaces. This mouse lacks some of the higher end features of the more expensive Logitech devices. But, for a simple to use and basic mouse, it is great. One caveat...the mouse comes with no instructions. The RF receiver for the USB in the computer is in the battery compartment. Remove the battery protection strips, plug in the receiver, turn it on. Easy, but there was no quick start guide.
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all your clicking and scrolling needs
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has seen me through some hard times and pivotal moments. It got me through my bachelors and is right by my side for grad school. This mouse helped me apply for loans and landed me my first job in my profession. It clicked me through every miserable button on my taxes. Together we opened a bank account and made mortgage payments. We’ve scrolled through photos and have played games together. It has supported me on impulse purchases and has never judged me when making credit card payments. It’s always steered me in the right direction. We’ve scrolled together and will grow old together.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Burke

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility with existing "USB Unifying Receiver for Computers and Laptops",
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is not very ergonomic (price) but the biggest problem is the lack of compatibility with the existing " Logitech USB Unifying Receiver for Computers and Laptops". The old mouse functions only intermittently and needed replacement, while the keyboard still works perfectly. The existing Logitech receiver still works perfectly with the keyboard but the new mouse does not respond, when I switch it to the new receiver, the mouse works but no keyboard. Hopefully Logitech gets (even tiny) complaints like this, so I will send images of all components for a possible resolution. Unifying taken seriously!
customer_reviews.author: NadoHeinz

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse but I prefer the older power switch.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good mouse with a nice design. My only disappointment is with the power switch. My old one which was many years old and dropped a few hundred times finally stopped being able to scroll. The left and right buttons still worked but I missed scrolling. Anyway, the old model used to have a quick one-handed slide for turning it on and off. This new model has a tiny slide that needs 2 hands, one to hold the mouse and the other to move the slide with your fingernail. Minor detail to most people but I miss the old power switch. That's why I only gave it 4 stars. Can't speak to the battery life as it's too new.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cinelli

customer_reviews.title: mid size mouse, scroll wheel is way too sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: A little larger than small laptop mouse, but not as large as a full size mouse. I like the size since I use a mouse 8 hours a day. I hope the battery last the advertised 3 years. Clicking is a little different than my old mouse, not sure what the difference is. The only downside of this mouse is the scroll wheel. There isn't any resistance so scrolling can get away. I barely touch the wheel and I'm several pages into my document. My Kensington mouse had "click" feel when scrolling
customer_reviews.author: G. Evans

customer_reviews.title: It arrived on time and worked fine. However
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wireless mouse on Feb 2nd. It arrived on time and worked fine. However, it stopped working at all exactly one week after the date for an accepted return. I tested the batteries and found that they were still full of good life. I inserted new ones anyway to be sure. The green light came on again but will not stay on. Apparently there is a short somewhere and now you won't replace it? Come on Amazon, really. A wireless mouse should only be good for 6 weeks? I have had others that worked for years. This is a pretty shoddy practice for Logitech and Amazon. Not impressed at all!
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding feel and this mouse works great directly on the desk, pant leg, fabric of recliner arm, sofa, mouse pad, etc.
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite little-mice, Logitech Wireless Mouse M525 - Red/Black, purchased for my wife to use with her new laptop and it's fantastic. The size, shape, weight, responsiveness and use of the toggling/rocking scroll wheel as the back/forward button is intuitive, easy to adapt to, and a great feature in our opinion. This mouse works on the mouse pad, directly on the desk top, pant leg, arm of the sofa, ... every surface we've tried it on it's been a pleasure to have and use. We liked this so much I decided to get another M525 of a different color for one of my extra PCs rather than sticking with a less expensive mouse.
customer_reviews.author: HowyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Pay close attention to the packaging
customer_reviews.text: Love the mouse. Almost sent it back because it looked like the USB receiver was missing. There is a little bubble in the packaging that looks like that's where the receiver should go but was missing. Chatting with Amazon it seems that the receiver is INSIDE the mouse. You would think it was missing if you didn't know this. For me the mouse is great. Smooth operation. It takes 2 AA batteries vs 1. Why? It only uses one at a time so when the first one is depleted the second one kicks in and you don't have to change batteries for a very long time. Wish I knew about the hidden receiver from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowdog

customer_reviews.title: Mouse feels fine.  Minor issues with use.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great for general use. The only issue I have is the slight clicking haptic response to the scroll wheel. If done slowly, this isn't an issue, but if you do it quickly, it makes a vibration sensation that annoys me, for some reason. This will most likely not bother most folks. I've owned other models of Logitech wireless mouse that didn't have this issue, so I may just have one that seems more perceptible to me, due to my medical issues, but it's something that I take note of every time I use it. It may well become less of an issue with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Redbeard

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in----Use it instantly
customer_reviews.text: I have an older, non-blue tooth HP computer. I had used a Logic Tech mouse for ever, because I don't manage the pad on the computer well. The dongle for my old mouse stuck out quite a bit from the side of the computer and often got caught on things. Finally, it quit working. I got this new mouse last week and plugged it in and instantly was using the mouse. I love it. It's a little smaller than my old mouse, hence the four stars. My hands are large and I liked the size of the old mouse more. I love that the batteries are guaranteed for two years.
customer_reviews.author: call4ed

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm setting up an HTPC for my dedicated home theater. I already had a spare Logitech wireless keyboard, but needed a mouse and this fits the bill for general work. My HTPC is in a large storage room next to the home theater, along with my other equipment (amps, etc.). I placed the dongle on a short USB extension wire and placed the wire next to the home theater sheetrock. I sit ~8 feet from the dongle and have no problems with the wireless signal cutting out and being balky. The mouse is a nice size, but if you are used to a very large mouse, it may take a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: DougMac

customer_reviews.title: 10 Month Follow Up; It Failed
customer_reviews.text: When this was first purchased in May 2019 I was really impressed. Now at only 10 months old I am sorry to announce this M525 has failed. My first Logitech failure at under 1 year. My previous M510 always lasted a couple years... I have a basic M310 that still works perfectly ~ it is almost 2 years old. This mouse's scrolling up & down abilities started going away over a month ago. Cleaned it, dusted it, new batteries ~ this morning no scrolling up. Ordering a new Logitech just not this M525 model...
customer_reviews.author: AmericanPatrick

customer_reviews.title: WiFi can interfere with the mouse.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works like any other, but initially I thought it was a dud as it wouldn't work properly unless it was within a few inches of the USB transceiver. This only happened when I was home. If I was using it at a different location there was no problem. So I changed the channel on my router, and the problem went away. One star off for that. Can't say anything about battery life, as I've only had it for a couple of weeks. All in all, except for that WiFi problem it;s a good mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to press and has loud scrolling
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the Logitech m510. I love it except it is very, very long and big and is too long for my small hand. I can barely touch the bottom of the scroll wheel. So I bought this one, the M525. The size is good for a small hand, but you have to press really hard on the button to put the scroll arrow where you want it. Also, the scroll wheel is very, very loud. Disappointed and will have to return this one, too. I previously had the Amazon mg-0975, but you have to replace the batteries every two to four weeks. Not sure what to get next!
customer_reviews.author: Okie Dokie KO

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy quality mouse
customer_reviews.text: My old logitech mose died after 10 years, and I tried to replace it with Microsoft mouse. Big mistake. After one week, bought this one (M25). Works great. Very well built, heavy - which is GOOD, scroll wheel gently clicks when turned, which provides better control. Fits perfectly into my big hands. Very precise movements and clicks. Overall - recommended. Too soon to tell about battery life, but as long as it runs for 6 months on one batter, I'm fine.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Like Logitech products
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Logitech at work for years and never experienced trouble with their products. This is why I based my decision to purchase this wireless mouse. So far I am happy with the item. Very comfortable in the hand, light to handle and precise response. Recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: I.Morris

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Bluetooth, Connects Instantly, Batteries Last
customer_reviews.text: This wireless mouse is much better than any Bluetooth mouse I've tried. It connects as soon as you move it, no waiting for it to reconnect. Every Bluetooth mouse I've used would run out of battery life within two weeks, not reliable enough for traveling. Logitech states the batteries will last up to 3 years so I'm all-in. It has a small dongle, receiver/transmitter, that stays in a USB port. It has all of the functions necessary, the wheel has a slight tactile feel during rotation which is nice. The wheel has left & right functions also with good tactile feedback. The LED must be infrared as there is no red glow. Overall, a well made, reliable wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: JCW3rd

customer_reviews.title: Too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations for this mouse due to the alleged very long battery life and the outstanding reviews. However, the scroll wheel of this mouse was simply way too sensitive. I tried to adjust the settings as much as I could, but the web pages and documents oftentimes would just go up and down from my finger barely touching it. There is no way to directly decrease the scroll wheel sensitivity, so I just replaced this mouse with the M510 and it was much better and had two additional buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Great tracking
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a Logitech mouse until I dripped it. I replaced it with another brand, and even though it was not as good used it until it died. Replaced that with a third brand and even though it was not as good as the old Logitech I had, it was comparable to the second one, so I used it until it died. I am glad I am back with Logitech! The tracking is so much more accurate and it is so much more comfortable, I will never stray again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I had a logitech mouse and it eventually stopped working after 5 yrs!! Made the mistake of buying a mouse for travel, and it looked fancy but has never been half as responsive or had anywhere near the battery life of the logitech. So after a painful year I went back to what I knew to be quality (logitech). Right away I can feel the difference, the way it fits my hand (large hands) the quick and accurate response, the center wheel that works like a dream, and actually cheaper than the other one. Thanks Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Davester

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. The mouse works on my granite counters, my wooden coffee table, and my couch without any problems. The receiver is very small. It worked immediately on my Mac. The storage inside the mouse is convenient. The one minor annoyance is that certain actions with the wheel aren't smooth. For example, the wheel is sensitive enough that it sometimes scrolls one unit when I'm trying to push the wheel down to click. Overall though, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Now I remember why I previously returned an M525
customer_reviews.text: It's the scrollwheel sensitivity. Basically, I prefer a mouse whose scrollwheel has a definite detent in it. The detent on this one is so slight it doesn't deserve the name. Barely touching the scrollwheel, like when you might want to depress it to open a link in a new tab, causes the page you are viewing to scroll, sometimes enough to scroll the link right out from underneath the mouse pointer. Then you have to reposition the pointer to try again. Even resting a finger on it can scroll the page a line or two. Maybe a gaming mouse is in my future.
customer_reviews.author: Chopped Ham

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have used Logitech products for a long time. I would have said as long as I can remember but I don't remember how long that is. Anyway, Logitech builds a great mouse. It has a great feel and I have large hands. I have little difficulty if any on most surfaces for the optic. I have always had great responsiveness. I have several wireless mice? I like them all. Installation is a snap, just follow the instructions. I use the mice on PC and Mac. Works well on both. Just remember to keep their little pads clean and they will continue to glide well.
customer_reviews.author: wfm2972

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fan: I don't recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected (replacing M310, which is not a large mouse either; I could see my hand cramping if I use it as often as I usually would) and the scroll-wheel makes the most annoying tinny noise. Doesn't seem like it would last very long. Would not purchase this model again and am considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Lacaille

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for a dead mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model mouse with a matching keyboard a few years ago. The mouse started acting up, so I decided to replace it. I liked the size and features, however, so I went with the same model from Logitech. I wanted to take advantage of the universal USB receiver for both the mouse and keyboard so I didn't use another USB slot, and the pairing of the new mouse was easy once I installed the "Logitech Unifying Software".
customer_reviews.author: James S. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Did Logitech change the design on this thing?
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought two, but the first one didn't work at all. Earlier this year, I bought what I thought was the same wireless Logitech mouse that had lasted me for about 3 1/2 years. What I didn't realize was that the shape of the mouse has either been changed or they don't sell that model anymore. The shape of this mouse is very uncomfortable and the buttons are stiff even after clicking them for a while, they haven't loosen up much at all.
customer_reviews.author: ISAAC MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: I love to travel w/ this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when I travel and here's why I love it. First, it fits my hand beautifully and the rolling device works very smoothly. It's lightweight. But my favorite? the receiver (the part that plugs into your computer) actually has a spot to store w/in this mouse. So when I am not traveling, I put the receiver back in this mouse, store in my suitcase until the next time. It's really very clever. And the battery life is terrific. So I highly recommend this! (And b/c I travel w/ it, it's been through being dropped, hit, etc. It travels great!!)
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Gal

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to be cheap, and got a memzuoix. The difference is impressive - I am not saying this is the best mouse, as it is a bit heavy in my hand - but - in comparison to the one, actually quite new, I am replacing, it is fantastic. By that I mean, it is accurate and fast. I should have bought Logitech in the first place - I have bought their equipment - mouse or remote - and been glad.
customer_reviews.author: Becky O

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse to replace the same one I've had for over 6 years. Still a functioning mouse, but the wheel side click stopped working. Logitech support was very helpful but problem would not fix. So I replaced it with the same mouse. Installed easy, works and integrated with my Logitech keyboard. I did have to reinstall the unifying software again because my keyboard quit working. All in all very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The feel and comfort of it are good. I didn't read the description well and notice that it only has the two buttons and the wheel. For normal computer work it is fine. It was more expensive the previous mouse I had which had more buttons on the side. I have a control pad that I use for gaming so I am not missing anything with it not having the extra buttons. Sad to say I mainly bought this mouse for the color. Would not recommend this mouse for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Doc P

customer_reviews.title: Constantly loses connection from three feet away.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what's going on, reinstalled the firmware to the dongle and the mouse, but it's still the same. Only stays connected for a moment or two. Needs constant unplugging and replugging to reinitialize it. My mouse arrow just disappears. Windows 10 Professional, fully updated, mouse software fully updated. No viruses, no nothing. Just a bad product. On the plus side, it uses two AA batteries for longer life.
customer_reviews.author: scottyfon

customer_reviews.title: Consistent quality from logitech
customer_reviews.text: Nice mouse for laptop use - portable and good quality. There are two gripes with this mouse. One - the USB transmitter is inside a compartment of the mouse. Would make it a bit more convenient if it was just in a slot on the bottom. But I guess it helps minimize the chance of loss. Second - the mouse has an on-off switch. Would make sense to have the transponder be the on-off mechanism. When the transponder is in the mouse, the power is disabled and power is on when it's out. Then no need for a separate switch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: THE LITTLE ANTENNA DID NOT COME WITH THIS MOUSE!
customer_reviews.text: The receiver was completely missing out of the sealed package. The photo of the antenna/receiver was printed on the paperwork but the actual receiver/antenna was completely missing! I've NEVER had a problem with this mouse missing a part before in the past. So I have a mouse that has no antenna/receiver to be able to use it!. Waste of money - will have to order another type I guess. I'll just go to BEST BUY to make sure it comes with what it's supposed to. Mistake by company during manufacturing I'm sure. Otherwise, I would have loved the mouse. It didn't fall out, I didn't lose it - It was not there! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So "quick" that it is difficult to control/use
customer_reviews.text: After several months of use, I've concluded that other negative reviews were accurate and that it is not a matter of "getting used to" the "quickness" of this mouse. It is consistently frustrating to use, but the issue is difficult to describe. In business use (spreadsheet, document, or preso creation/editing, email) it is all but impossible to get this mouse to select what you want and to stay on that selection. It is so "skittish" and "quick" to shift that it negatively impacts productivity. After years of satisfactory use with earlier-version logitech mice, this one is a major disappointment. I will be discarding and attempting to replace with another model.
customer_reviews.author: Scottsdale

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super mouse! I'm really enjoying using it. Moving back and forth between screens the way my office is set up is a pain with a wired mouse! This one does the job! I can move things easily now without being tied to my main screen. It fits comfortably and reacts well. I have no complaints! Great price for a name brand product. Completely comfortable recommending this mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa-Ann

customer_reviews.title: worst mouse ever in using computers in 20 yrs
customer_reviews.text: Battery seems great no problem Connectivity great no drivers needed plug and play as far as performance I didn't need all the extra buttons but this things skips or jumps goes slighty diagonal when going sideways again ive gone thru plenty mouse in 20 yrs this is so garbage to even the cheapest oem mouse. on scale with cracker box play toy performance quality maybe I got a bad one but ewww just eww
customer_reviews.author: Heather Adam

customer_reviews.title: Only worked well for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: this mouse only worked for 3 months, can't keep it on the screen. Contacted Tech support they spent 20 minutes trouble shooting with no improvement & were suppose to call me the next day to link me with logitech & never called. Suppose to have a warranty but can't get in touch with anyone to uphold it
customer_reviews.author: Beachblonde

customer_reviews.title: So far good
customer_reviews.text: Received it yesterday, and so far we both like it a lot. It's got some nice weight to it so it feels stable. The shape and look are sleek. It's a bit smaller than the MS mouse I'm used to, but not so much to make it uncomfortable. I plugged the receiver into one of the front USB ports, turned the mouse on, and it was working in 10 seconds. I recommend this mouse. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's not a nice looking mouse, but it works very well. This is the third mouse I've bought. This one is for my restaurant.It's not a nice looking mouse, but it works very well. This is the third mouse I've bought. This one is for my restaurant.It's not a nice looking mouse, but it works very well. This is the third mouse I've bought. This one is for my restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Smooth as butter!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I could get excited about a ridiculous MOUSE, but this thing is like driving a Maserati versus a VW. Use it with the mouse pad I reference below and you'll never look back. Hey, the DONGLE is hidden IN the battery compartment, so look there when you buy this. 3M Precise Mouse Pad with Non-skid Foam Back, Enhances the Precision of Optical Mice at Fast Speeds and Extends the Battery Life of Wireless Mice up to 50%, 9" x 8", Frostbyte (MP114-BSD2)
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Guy

customer_reviews.title: Beats the touch pad on a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I hate/cannot use touch pads on laptop computers so I use Logitech wireless mice. I would not be without one on a laptop and even a desktop computer. They all work I buy the simplest and cheapest models. Oh, and they don't last forever but I use them heavy and am satisfied with the usage I get from them. Sometimes they just get clogged with dirt and they need a little cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after 6 Months Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to use with an HP N5000 notebook in December 2019. I liked the mouse and had no complaints until it stopped working in June 2020. In June it would disconnect intermittently then stopped working altogether, with a "USB device failed" message on the computer. I replaced new batteries and used with an older HP desktop computer, where at first it worked then also stopped working after a time, both Windows 10 devices. There are no updated drivers on the Logitech website that I could find. (I haven't seen any mouse that requires a separate driver in a number of years.) Very disappointed with the performance of this device. I'd return or exchange it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Trovato 55

customer_reviews.title: long lasting quality
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great. I have two of 'em. The life of the mouse itself, and the battery, are very good. Prior to this purchase, I used this one's predecessor all day at work for many years. This new design has a plastic piece at the tip of the thumb which answered the only issue I ever had with the previous model (thumbnail would wear out the materiel).
customer_reviews.author: Happy Package

customer_reviews.title: Nice little mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse for use on my new laptop. The laptop is running on Ubuntu Linux and I was somewhat surprised that the laptop recognized the mouse. You will have to fiddle with the mouse speed, but that's normal. You will have to get use to the scroll wheel and the 3rd button. Overall, after my first few uses, I am impressed with this small mouse.
customer_reviews.author: CCM

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse for my Samsung Chromebook. It works great. It is on the small side, but provides great control and is very precise. It pairs easily and is handy to carry. I have large hands and it appears small, but when given the chance to switch to a large mouse, I ultimately went back to this one. The control is awesome. I would recommend it for anyone who has a need of a wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewinator

customer_reviews.title: Great Ergonomics for Travel Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had an older black model whose teflon feet finally wore through. I have large hands and the travel size never bothered me. I also really liked that I had page forward and page back operation through side clicks on the scroll wheel. Battery life was legendary. Put in some Energizer Lithium cells and I bet the batteries outlive the service life of the mouse. Enjoyed it enough that I ordered a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Family

customer_reviews.title: Sluggish Dinosaur
customer_reviews.text: The clicking never bothers me. What does is the roller wheel is loose as in rattles and doesn't feel right. It used 2 batteries!! I must have missed that part in the description, my bad. I'll own that one. But, what mouse needs two batteries nowadays? Sluggish, unbelievably sluggish as in you have to d*r*a*g it along the mouse pad to get it where you want to go. It wouldn't be what I would recommend in 2019. Maybe back in the 90's
customer_reviews.author: Lea Ann

customer_reviews.title: Logitech M525 wireless mouse review
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech M525 wireless mouse came in new/mint condition as promised by seller, Amazon. I plugged in the receiver directly to usb and in my usb hub and it works! The mouse feels great while using it. The size of the mouse is great for portability. Since this thing is optical, it will work on more surfaces than laser. Any laser mouse I use never works on wood or laminate or glossy or glossy/laminate desks. Not this mouse, the M525 works on these too. Get this, without a mouse pad! Holla!!
customer_reviews.author: Poria M

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I am really picky about the mice I use with my laptop and computer. It needs to fit my hand comfortably, needs to not feel like a hollow plastic shell, have enough weight to feel like something is actually in my hand , the buttons have to be responsive and the sensitivity needs to be consistent across multiple surface types. This mouse hits all the right buttons for my needs... though I would like it more if it was just a tad heavier...
customer_reviews.author: BSDZ-2000

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic?
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a tracball for years but they just didn't last and were not ergonomic at all FOR ME. Trying this. Not sure that it's any more ergonomic than the Logotech Trackball. I use it with a laptop and it works on any surface including the laptop surface, the rocker recliner leather arm, my bare leg and 1/4 inch above any surface. We'll see if it lasts any longer than 6mos like the Trackball
customer_reviews.author: Martin H JacobyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: stupid packaging hides instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, once you figure out how to use it. The packaging hides the instructions-- they expect you to totally dismantle the hard-to-open plastic bubble and take out the cardboard innards, where the instructions are hidden. Yes, there is a plug to put into your computer, but it's camouflaged inside the mouse. The plastic bubble where you would think it should be, is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Tawny Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Last 2 1/2 months. Now doesn't work. Cant believe it an Amazon choice, must have paid for that designation. Changed the batteries plug an unplugged, nothing. Laptop is reading it but not working. Rip off ,junk ,crap any name you want but good quality as it is crappy quality, wasted my money 2 1/2 months and then dead. Price increase since i bought it but still wasted twenty bucks on a crappy mouse
customer_reviews.author: bm

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse
customer_reviews.text: Being left handed, the way a mouse fits in my hand is important. There are a number of mice that are supposed to work in either hand, but they are really designed for right handed people. This mouse works very well for me. The roller wheel is extremely smooth - another plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jim N

customer_reviews.title: Did Not last 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse and it suppose to have 3 years battery life. This mouse didn't last 1 year. I have changed the battery a couple of times . I haven't used it 1 year and it has totally quit. I changed the battery and it still will not work. I have tried it on 3 different computers and it is just dead even with new batteries. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Piece Missing!
customer_reviews.text: This wireless mouse is suppose to come with "Two" pieces, the mouse and the tiny part that goes into the computer/laptop thumb-drive. Mine came without the tiny piece rendering this wireless mouse completely useless! You can understand a piece missing when there are hundreds of parts but two pieces, absolutely ridiculous! I promptly chucked this mouse into the trashcan where it belongs! I know all about return policies, which I simply do not have the time to screw with. Very disappointing and frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Flipse

customer_reviews.title: Does't roll smoothly - skips
customer_reviews.text: When you get a mouse, you want it to roll smoothly and easily. Unfortunately the mouse we received skips and doesn't have good connection to the pad. I find it difficult to even place the cursor on a specific line of text to edit...so we will have to replace it. It's sad because it is esthetically a nice mouse...just not practically.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Always keep one as a spare
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of different mice but this is the one I keep coming back to. I don't find it overly sensitive at all. Unfortunately, I have some feline friends who treat it like a real mouse and have knocked it onto the floor many, many times. Because of that, I always keep a brand new spare on hand in my desk so I'm never without. Easy on batteries and it just simply works.
customer_reviews.author: superdogmom

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomics and tactile feedback for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this one to replace a dead mouse, and I must say I don't know what I've been missing. The Logitech M525 seems to work very well across many kinds of surfaces, fabric, leather, glass, even thick towls. The key click is subtle but solid and deliberate, as is the mouse wheel which is not at all overly sensitive but still provides a nice tactile feedback. Very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: B&C FugettTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Love this MOUSE!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse as a replacement for the same one I had that bit the dust. I love this mouse as it is comfortable to use for longer periods of time. The scrolling wheel works smoothly. Love that I can get the mouse in red or a different color so that it is easy to find when moving from my home to work locations. Great product that lasts for years. (My last one lasted for 4+ years even with being dropped onto cement and tile floors several time.)
customer_reviews.author: Jean H.

customer_reviews.title: MEDIUM SIZE COMPUTER MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to replace one that stopped working, probably because it fell at least 20 times a day. I didn't like the feel of this mouse when I originally received it, as my other one was more compact. I am getting used to it. It is fussy about what you use it one, mouse pad, chair, table etc, where my other one you could run it on my leg. It is also a little heavy compared to the compact one.
customer_reviews.author: wildkitten

customer_reviews.title: MICRO-PRECISE SCROLL WHEEL has little rubber grip.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased it was because of the tred on the wheel, pictured in the sales ad. You have to use a magnifying glass to see the tred on the one I received. Otherwise it's all good. Ad said: MICRO-PRECISE SCROLL WHEEL - With more grooves per millimeter, our new scroll wheel gives you the ultimate navigation experience
customer_reviews.author: ddruggs

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item a 3 start rating for only one reason. The item is advertised with "Long 3 Year Battery Life". I purchased two of these for the wife and I, and the batteries ran dry for both items within just two weeks. Other than that, I would recommend this item as it is very comfortable to use. Everything seems to function well, as described.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money unless you only need a mouse for 4 months! I bought this one after my old one started having issues with the USB driver not being recognized and I thought it was because it was old and outdated. The new one started having the same problem off and on after 4 months and then completely stopped working a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not working well (or at all) after only 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this only 4 months ago. It worked well initially but now it's frequently unresponsive: either doesn't move the cursor at all or the cursor skips around. I've changed the battery and ensured no dust or other particles are on the laser "eye." I've used a different Logitech wireless mouse for my work laptop and never had a problem, and I've had it far longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a bad mouse.  edit or maybe it's just a bad product.
customer_reviews.text: Well it worked really great for about a month. Then the mouse icon disappeared from the screen. I noticed the power light went out. I recycled the power a few times, and it would come back on for about 15 seconds, then shut off again. Tried new batteries even though it's only a month old, same thing. Thanks goodness for amazon's return policy. I'll give another one a shot. If that one dies . . . Update oct 20, 2020 I got home turned on the pc's, one media one gaming and this mouse's scrolling function quit working. Clicking and the sideways thing worked. I swapped mice between the computers and sure enough, no scrolling.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this mouse for work for years and also have one for home use and it works great. a good size thats comfortable for the hand and I never have any issues with it which is a miracle given how many times I have dropped my work one when wondering about the office. its definitely sturdy and has been going strong for 3+ years so far without any sign of it dying so cant beat that for the price!
customer_reviews.author: khaleesi

customer_reviews.title: Reliable with a long lasting battery
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. It works perfectly and connects to the pc easily. I have had it a couple of months now and the batteries that came with it are still in the mouse. The battery compartment is easy to open and close. The location of the battery compartment release is in a good location and the compartment closes back fully easily.
customer_reviews.author: MarkandTina

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: My previous mouse was a bit larger than this one but it stopped working. I couldn't find the same mouse on line so I have this one a try. It works. A bit small and I have small hands, it's probably good for a child's hand so I may give it to my daughter. But other than that it does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kevia

customer_reviews.title: Worthless if you middle-click with any regularity
customer_reviews.text: Touted as an "upgrade" to the M505, the M525 has an impossible-to-use scroll wheel that takes off at the slightest bump. Even after trying for a while to fine-tune the settings in Logitech's SetPoint software I cannot middle-click with any reliability - instead, the page will scroll up and down, missing the link or tab I am trying to click. Then it takes 3-4 seconds to line things back up and hopefully not jump the page again. I ended up going back to my M505 with no hesitation and relegated the M525 to storage for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Scholz

customer_reviews.title: The Smoothest Scrolling Mouse I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This mouse device glides with ease and the wheel scroll feels so smooth. I would most definitely buy another one and even gift one. It's very comfortable on the hand also. I had carpal surgery a few months ago and this is helpful, along with a gel pad with wrist support. Treat your body right, including your hands and wrists.
customer_reviews.author: OwensArtsy

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Tracking to the Point of being Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of the package, the horizontal tracking was just fine. But the vertical tracking seemed to be operating at 10% strength. Hard to describe, but something seemed to be off straight from the get-go. Pretty disappointed. I've had cheaper mice for over 5 years that still track perfectly normal, yet this one, brand new, had issues.
customer_reviews.author: sdesign9

customer_reviews.title: Best mice are made by Logitech. This is one of them.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for laptop to take to meetings. I hate the trackpad on laptops. Logitech makes the best mice. I buy the 703 for my desktops. I think its too small for gaming, but maybe smaller hands would like it. Excellent sensitivity on a variety of surfaces. I bought this even though the company should have purchased one for me. I didn't want a cheap five dollar model.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hollins

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse used at a $6 savings with free shipping from Netzero4. It arrived within 5 business days in very good condition, with no signs of wear on its top surfaces and little natural wear on the bottom. The mouse has a compartment for two batteries but easily runs on just one which makes its weight much lighter when in use. The mouse functions very smoothly as all my Logitech unifyer mouse's/mice (I have three) do using Logitech's mouse and keyboard software. I would advise folks not to depend on Windows mouse software but to ensure you use Logitech software for setting up and using your mouse and keyboards for proper function.
customer_reviews.author: Doplar

customer_reviews.title: No USB transmitter and no installation instructions
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model for some years and would give it five stars. However I was disappointed buying this replacement to find no USB transmitter was included despite one being pictured on the package, nor were their any installation instructions. A second barcode label (that covered the original one) showed an item list with the USB item obliterated by being printed over. Don't buy this item if you need a USB transmitter/receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Bowness

customer_reviews.title: They’ve changed the build of this for the worse.
customer_reviews.text: My problem is the clear difference in build quality vs an older version I have of this. Much cheaper build. Plastic is flimsy, scroll wheel makes a very different sound and has a much cheaper feel. The weight and heft/balance is very different than my older model too. I use both and the difference is stark. On the upside, still a decent mouse. Two stars because of bad value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D

customer_reviews.title: Good 20-dollar mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've used 305 mice for 10 years and in comparison, this new one is slight larger n heavier, less ergo, does not slide as easy same pad, clicks a slight louder (but no where near 325 loud), finger force to click is a tad more, and wheel spins too freely - screen rolls sloppy. I'll always use model 305 as a measuring stick. Overall Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Richards

customer_reviews.title: Mouse has internal storage for Wireless Tranceiver.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is great! Great battery life, scroll forward, back, left, and right. Delivery fell short of my expectations. We’ve had off & on rain, so have a box on porch for deliveries to keep them dry! Package was left out on sidewalk in weather. Fortunately the mouse was in waterproof plastic pack!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Mouse tab inside mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had read complaints about the mouse tab that usually comes with a mouse and goes in the back of your hard drive. This one however is included inside the mouse right under the batteries. It didn’t work for computer there, so I removed it, and placed inside the hard drive where my other mouse one had been. It works fine this way. The dark red color is almost a burgundy & went perfect with my mouse pad. Very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hughbud

customer_reviews.title: Always will buy
customer_reviews.text: Logitech mouses is the only mouse I by. I tried a different brand and as soon as I started using it, my computer started to mess up. Logitech have a great battery life and I love the action when I play games. It responds quickly and smoothly. I’ll continue to only buy this brand. I also buy them for my husband, the company he works for supplies mouses but he hates them. For a great mouse the price is unbeatable
customer_reviews.author: LBEAR

customer_reviews.title: Time-Tested
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid little mouse. This one was a gift for my mother, but I bought one of these in...2014'ish...and I used it to played Fallout New Vegas on a non-gaming laptop in Afghanistan in 2015. It was full of grease and sand at the time and to this day (2020) it still works exactly the same (I probably dropped it on the concrete floor about 30 times). I also had to replaced the batteries, like, three times in it's entire lifetime. Obviously I now have better mice for gaming, but I still keep this one for my school laptop. (It's like an old friend at this point)
customer_reviews.author: Trent D.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Works very well, long battery life...
customer_reviews.text: I own like 2 of these on my own laptops and also purchased for church laptops as well, including this one. They are comfy, have Iaser precision, fit my hand well, and have very long battery life. The best part is the laser tracking mechanism works on nearly ANY smooth flat surface. Be it a desk, book, magazine, mousepad, chair, couch, or even floor.
customer_reviews.author: Netcruiser2

customer_reviews.title: Smaller replacement for my M705
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of this mouse and that the wheel acts as the forward and back buttons. I haven't had it long enough to test the battery life, but it came with batteries and has worked fine for all applications. It's really a great little mouse and very easy to install. Plug in the unifying USB and away you go, no sweat, no strain. I have a lot of Logitech products and find that I can trust them to provide a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless mouse for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd gone wireless sooner! No more tripping over wires. Easy to synch and setup, had it working within seconds of unboxing. Just plug the receiver into your PC's USB port, adjust the mouse speed in the control panel (mine was too fast), and you're good to go. Works like a charm. Like it so much, bought a Logitech wireless keyboard (also great). I'm sure the battery life will be long, but I still turn it off when I'm done. Love it, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is as heavy as a paper weight! Works fine, but you have to pick it up and lift it to get the mouse throughout your documents (as you would with any mouse), and it's a little difficult to lift it because it's too heavy and not ergonomically designed to be picked up and lifted.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Set up is tricky
customer_reviews.text: There is a plastic bubble on the case where it appears the receiver should be, but it's actually hidden inside the mouse. The manual is in multiple languages and thus the font is minute. Used a magnifying glass, but the manual was pretty useless. Found a PDF on the web, managed to download and install the driver, but it was a struggle to get this mouse working. The mouse was fine once the initial hurdle was passed. Could definitely use a better manual/instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality in this replacement mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite mouse. I used my last one so much that I wore out the 4 little black pads on the bottom. That mouse still works well, but this new one is even better. Some people say that this mouse is far to sensitive, but I solved that problem long ago with a few Windows control panel adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: One-Shot Scot

customer_reviews.title: Logitech is not anymore what it was before!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse 8 month ago now the cursor is frozen very often and mouse is not respond at all! Very disappointed in Logitech quality. By the way, we had return two Logitech keyboards in а raw, both of them were falling apart! Now I will definitely stay far away from this company what was my favorite for so many years!
customer_reviews.author: Aiva

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Lenovo Yoga Notebook. I plugged it in and it works with no issues. I can set the speed of the cursor and other functions with no problems. I don't use it for gaming but it is fact if you set it that way, so it would probably work well for that purpose. I have only had it for a few months so I can't say anything about it's 3 year battery life. But I am happy with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Haig1

customer_reviews.title: great mouse for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wireless mouse that was full size to use on my google chromebook so i could have a portable mouse without spending much money. I have owned this mouse for a few years now and i still use it from time to time and it still works like the day i bought it. it is comfortable to use over long periods of time but lacks some of the extra buttons or premium feel from a more expensive mouse. if you are looking for a cheap, durable, easy to use mouse with logitech's "unifying feature" (which allows you to use only one dongle to connect up to i believe 5 logitech devices) than this i the mouse for you.
customer_reviews.author: Hunters Paradox

customer_reviews.title: Believe the battery life claims.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this mouse since January 2013. I use it daily for hours at a time with a Macbook Pro. I usually switch it off when not using. In the entire time I've owned this mouse, I've only needed to replace the batteries ONCE. I have never had a better mouse in terms of battery life or ergonomics. Recently I thought I lost it tried out new mice at Staples. Nothing compared. This mouse is comfortable to use and very responsive. I may have to buy a backup.
customer_reviews.author: jaclynn

customer_reviews.title: Compact and smooth
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used, after 2 weeks the mouse wheel stopped. Opened the case up and found battery corrosion had attacked the pcb rendering it useless after another few days. It was a good deal and arrived really clean on the outside, next time I know to check the pcb on a used mouse. Was good while I had it. Upgraded to a m510 and it's even better.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Comand

customer_reviews.title: A good reasonably priced mouse
customer_reviews.text: I don't play games. I use my computer for browsing the internet and designing woodworking projects. It replaced an older, but similar Logitech mouse in which the scroll feature wore out. Th wireless feature is important to me because a cable will get in the way while I am drawing something. I use an Apple computer and this mouse is as good as any Apple mouse at a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

product_meta.title: Logitech Wireless Mouse M525 - Navy/Grey
product_meta.description:
Style:Mouse| Color:Navy/Grey| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingWith micro-precise scrolling, ultra-smooth cursor control and super-long-and-reliable battery power, the compact Logitech Wireless Mouse M525 screams control-and personal style in your choice of sweet color combinations.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



FEATURES




COMPARE


Which Logitech wireless mouse is right for you?




CREATE THE COMBO THAT WORKS FOR YOU
Logitech has a range of products that you can connect via a single, tiny unifying receiver you leave plugged in to your notebook. Mix. Match. Unify. Now you can create your perfect laptop workstation, wherever you work.
feature_bullets: Micro precision scroll wheel: Faster, easier web navigation plus advanced optical sensor for smooth tracking on more surfaces, USB receiver is stored inside the mouse where the batteries are located
Extended battery life: Go for upto three years without a battery change (battery life may vary based on user and computing conditions)
Compact comfort in cool colors: Ergonomic shape, soft rubber grips and great style that's easy to take anywhere

Multi device wireless receiver: Tiny unifying receiver connects up to six unifying compatible devices; Mouse dimensions (height x width x depth) 4 x 2.2 x 1.5 inches; Receiver dimensions (height x width x depth) 0.5 x 0.7 x 0.2 inches
For windows and MAC computers: Works with windows xp, vista, 7 and MAC OS x 10.5 or later

specifications.Operating System: Windows xp, Mac os x leopard, Windows vista
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,394 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
